text: Louis Lansana Beavogui (28 December 1923 â€“ 19 August 1984) was a Guinean politician. He was the first Prime Minister of Guinea from 26 April 1972 to 3 April 1984 and was interim President from 26 March 1984 to 3 April 1984. Beavogui was born on 28 December 1923 in Macenta, French Guinea (now Guinea) and died of diabetesWest Africa Annual (13th edition, 1996), page 188. while hospitalized in Conakry, Guinea on 19 August 1984, aged 60."Jul 1985 - Government changes - Foreign and economic policy of military government - Release of detained members of former regime - Attempted coup", Keesing's Record of World Events, Volume 31, July, 1985 Guinea, Page 33709. == References == Category:1923 births Category:1984 deaths Category:Prime ministers of Guinea Category:Presidents of Guinea Category:Mayors Category:African diplomats Category:Deaths from diabetes Category:Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany
title: Louis Lansana Beavogui
